citeinfo.origin: National Park Service (NPS) Geologic Resource Evaluation (GRE) program
citeinfo.title: Digital Linear Dikes of Appomattox Court House National Historical Park and Vicinity, Virginia (NPS, GRD, GRE, APCO, APCODKE)

citeinfo.origin: National Park Service (NPS) Geologic Resource Evaluation (GRE) program
citeinfo.title: Digital Geologic Map of Appomattox Court House National Historical Park and Vicinity, Virginia

descript.abstract: The Digital Linear Dikes of Appomattox Court House National Historical Park and Vicinity, Virginia consists of linear intrusives mapped as line (arc) features. The data were completed as a component of the Geologic Resource Evaluation (GRE) program, a National Park Service (NPS) Inventory and Monitoring (I&M) funded program that is administered by the NPS Geologic Resources Division (GRD). The data were captured, grouped and attributed as per the NPS GRE Geology-GIS Geodatabase Data Model v. 1.4. (available at: http://science.nature.nps.gov/im/inventory/geology/GeologyGISDataModel.cfm). The data layer is available as a feature class in a 9.1 personal geodatabase (apco_geology.mdb). The Linear Dikes (APCODKE) GIS data layer is also available as a coverage export (.E00) file (APCODKE.E00), and as a shapefile (.SHP) file (APCODKE.SHP). Each GIS data format has an ArcGIS 9.1 layer (.LYR) file (APCODKE_GDB.LYR (geodatabase feature class), APCODKE_COV.LYR (coverage), APCODKE_SHP.LYR (shapefile)) with map symbology that is included with the GIS data. See the Distribution Information section for additional information on data acquisition. The GIS data projection is NAD83, UTM Zone 17N. The data is within the area of interest of Appomattox Court House National Historical Park.
descript.purpose: The data are intended to assist NPS personnel in the protection and management of Appomattox Court House National Historical Park. The digital data is of limited use as GIS data as the source scale, 1:500,000, is very small-scale. Feature positional accuracy maybe as high as 417'(127 meters) of the feature's mapped position.
descript.supplinf: This dataset is just one component of the Digital Geologic Map of Appomattox Court House National Historical Park and Vicinity, Virginia. The data layers (feature classes) that comprise the Digital Geologic Map of Appomattox Court House National Historical Park and Vicinity, Virginia include: APCODKE (Linear Dikes), APCOFLT (Faults), APCOGLG (Geologic Units) and APCOGLGA (Geologic Contacts). There are three additional ancillary map components, the Geologic Unit Information (APCOGLG1) Table, the Source Map Information (APCOMAP) Table and the Map Help File (apco_geology.hlp). Refer to the NPS GRE Geology-GIS Geodatabase Data Model v. 1.4 (available at: http://science.nature.nps.gov/im/inventory/geology/GeologyGISDataModel.cfm) for detailed data layer (feature class) and table specifications including attribute field parameters, definitions and domains, and implemented topology rules and relationship classes.

idinfo.useconst: Not for use at scale greater than 1:500,000 (source map scale). The digital data is of limited use as GIS data as the source scale, 1:500,000, is very small-scale. Feature positional accuracy maybe as high as 417'(127 meters) of the feature's mapped position.
idinfo.datacred: Andrea Croskrey and Georgia Hybels (NPS Geologic Resources Division)
idinfo.native: ESRI ArcGIS 9.1 and Microsoft Windows XP

attracc.attraccr: Feature attribution was derived from and checked with the source map(s). Attribution was checked (QCd) for errors. Users of this data are advised to FULLY and CAREFULLY READ the "DISTRIBUTION LIABILITY" section of this metadata before using the data.

dataqual.logic: GIS data in 9.1 personal geodatabase (.MDB), coverage export (.E00) file and shapefile (.SHP) file formats.
dataqual.complete: Data is considered complete to the extent of the source map(s).

horizpa.horizpar: Data, produced from digital source data, is assumed to meet National Map Accuracy Standards. The digital data is of limited use as GIS data as the source scale, 1:500,000, is very small-scale. Feature positional accuracy maybe as high as 417'(127 meters) of the feature's mapped position. The PRECISION of the Export (.E00) file and Shapefile (.SHP) file is DOUBLE.

citeinfo.title: Digital Representation of the 1993 Geologic Map of Virginia

pubinfo.publish: Virginia Department of Mines, Minerals and Energy, Division of Mineral Resources (VDMR)

srcinfo.srccontr: Features were derived from source data. Source data attribution was used to attribute features, as per the NPS GRE Geology-GIS Geodatabase Data Model v. 1.4.

procstep.procdesc: Features were produced from source data. Source data attribution was used to attribute features as per the NPS GRE Geology-GIS Geodatabase Data Model v. 1.4. Topology rules were imposed to check for and correct topology errors. Topology rules maintain spatial coincidence between features and related features in another feature class, as well as maintain defined spatial relationships within a single feature class. Relationship classes were also used to ensure attribution consistency. For more details about imposed topological and relationship rules, see the NPS GRE Geology-GIS Geodatabase Data Model v. 1.4 (available at: http://science.nature.nps.gov/im/inventory/geology/GeologyGISDataModel.cfm). Features were exported from the geodatabase to coverage and shapefile (.SHP) formats.

overview.eaover: Refer to the NPS GRE Geology-GIS Geodatabase Data Model v. 1.4 (available at: http://science.nature.nps.gov/im/inventory/geology/GeologyGISDataModel.cfm) for detailed data layer (feature class) and table attribute field parameters, definitions and domains, and implemented relationship classes. A Detailed Description section is not present (above) as standard GIS fields dependent on GIS format (e.g. OBJECTID, SHAPE, FNODE_) are not consistent throughout the GRE deliverable GIS formats (personal geodatabase, coverage and shapefile).
overview.eadetcit: NPS GRE Geology-GIS Geodatabase Data Model v. 1.4. (available at: http://science.nature.nps.gov/im/inventory/geology/GeologyGISDataModel.cfm)

cntinfo.cntinst: GRE data are available at the NPS Data Store: http://science.nature.nps.gov/nrdata

distinfo.resdesc: GIS map data available in APCOGDB.ZIP (9.1 personal geodatabase (.MDB) file), APCOCOV.ZIP (coverage and table export (.E00) files) or APCOSHP.ZIP (shapefile (.SHP) and DBASEIV (.DBF) table files)
distinfo.distliab:
The National Park Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such.
The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. The related graphics are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not appropriate to use the related graphics as data.
The National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an NPS server and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the National Park Service, no warranty, expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies to both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.

onlinopt.accinstr: Download the digital geologic-GIS map (Larger Work Citation) metadata (APCO_GREMAP.XML) or the .ZIP download file (APCOGDB.ZIP) with the personal geodatabase (.MDB) file containing the feature class.
Download the digital geologic-GIS map (Larger Work Citation) metadata (APCO_GREMAP.XML) or the .ZIP download file (APCOCOV.ZIP) with the coverage export (.E00) file.
Download the digital geologic-GIS map (Larger Work Citation) metadata (APCO_GREMAP.XML) or the .ZIP download file (APCOSHP.ZIP) with the shapefile (.SHP) files.
